sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>tsunami</radical> hits a <radical>tree</radical> and your <radical>hat</radical> protects you from the <radical>water</radical>, but the hat itself is now covered in <kanji>lacquer</kanji>. You take it off and see that it's shiny and hard and protected.
meaningInfo: Picture your hat and all of the other things the tsunami + tree water touched. It's all been hardened with a thick coating of the lacquer.
readingMnemonic: You decide to scoop up the rest of the <kanji>lacquer</kanji> water and use it on your furniture to protect it from your <reading>shih tzu</reading> (<ja>しつ</ja>). Now it can't bite or scratch or ruin any of your things anymore!
readingInfo: Watch as your shih tzu tries to bite your now lacquered chair. It gets its teeth around the leg, but it's hard as a rock. The shih tzu starts sneezing and spitting, letting go. Looks like it tastes bad too. Perfect!
